_header: O fie Fortune fie thy deceit and scorn
Title(s): ‘Nor yet y trust heraftir shalt thou not’
Subjects: Fortune, complaint against; envoys; complaints, lovers’
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, ‘Nor yet y trust heraftir shalt thou not’ — three 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) with this refrain and 4-line Envoy (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 164)

BLHar682.First Lines:
O ffy fortune fy þi dissayt and skorneffor all þi fraude
                    retorne yet wilfully…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…ffor yet ye get me not for all yowre spyNor yet y trust
                    heraftir shalt þou not
